page.title: 03Homeless in Brighton
page.content: Brighton has a serious housing problem, with 1500 people in bed and breakast accomodation, 200 people sleeping rough, 40 people in the resettlement unit and about 1500 families are on the Council housing waiting list. Brighton Housing Trust, a charity, organises a nightly soup run on the seafront for people sleeping rough. The number of homeless people is expected to increase considerably as a result of the latest government ruling which requires unemployed people under the age of 26 living in bed and breakfast accomodation to move out of the travel_to_work area after every two weeks. Homeless people suffer from a complexity of problems: poverty, unemployment, sometimes drug abuse and alcoholism.The other side of Brighton!
